trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow"></xref> objects in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> control.
The DetailsViewRowCollection class is used to store and manage a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> objects in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.
Each row in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control is represented by a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control uses the DetailsViewRowCollection class for its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Rows%2A> property.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Rows%2A> property contains only the data rows.

To access the header row, footer row, top pager row, and bottom pager row, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.HeaderRow%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.FooterRow%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.TopPagerRow%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.BottomPagerRow%2A> properties, respectively.

The DetailsViewRowCollection class supports several ways to access the items in the collection: - Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.Item%2A> indexer to directly retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object from the collection at a specific zero-based index.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to retrieve an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the items in the collection into an array, which can then be used to access the items in the collection.
To determine the total number of items in the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection.Count%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection"></xref> class using the specified <xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> object.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> class using the specified <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList> object.
The <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList> object contains the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> objects with which to populate the collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> that contains the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow"></xref> objects with which to initialize the collection.

Copies all the items from this <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection"></xref> object to the specified <xref:System.Array> object, starting at the specified index in the <xref:System.Array>.
Use this method to copy the items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object into the specified array, starting at the specified index.
The array can then be used to access the items in the collection.
> [!NOTE] > You must use a zero-based array for the `array` parameter.
A zero-based <xref:System.Array> that receives the copied items from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection"></xref>.
The first index in the specified <xref:System.Array> to receive the copied contents.
Gets the number of items in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection"></xref> object.
Use the Count property to determine the number of items in the collection.
The Count property is commonly used when iterating through the collection to determine its upper bound.
The Count property is also commonly used to determine whether a collection is empty.
The number of items in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection"></xref>.
Returns an enumerator that contains all <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection"></xref> object.
Use this method to get an enumerator that can be iterated through linearly to access each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object.
To access the item at the current position in the enumerator, use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A> property.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> method to move to the next item in the collection.
To move the enumerator to its initial position, use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A> method.

> [!NOTE] > When you initially get the enumerator or use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection, you must call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A> method.
Otherwise, the item represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A> property is undefined.

An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator>-implemented object that contains all <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the rows in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection"></xref> object can be modified.
Use the IsReadOnly property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object can be modified.

> [!NOTE] > This property has been overridden to always return `false`, to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object can be modified in all cases.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection"></xref> object is synchronized (thread safe).
Use the IsSynchronized property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object is thread safe.
> [!NOTE] > This property has been overridden to always return `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object is not thread safe.
For more information on the IsSynchronized property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow"></xref> object from the collection at the specified index.
Use this indexer to retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object from the collection at the specified index, using array notation.
The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow"></xref> to retrieve from the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow"></xref> at the specified index in the collection.
Gets the object used to synchronize access to the collection.
Use the SyncRoot property to get an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object itself.
For more information on the SyncRoot property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
A <xref:System.Object?displayProperty=fullName> that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

Copies all the items from this <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection"></xref> object to the specified <xref:System.Array> object, starting at the specified index in the <xref:System.Array>.

This implementation of the ICollection.CopyTo method is a helper method used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> class to copy the items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection> object into the specified <xref:System.Array> object, starting at the specified index.
The <xref:System.Array> object can then be used to access the items in the collection.
> [!NOTE] > You must use a zero-based <xref:System.Array> object for the `array` parameter.
A zero-based <xref:System.Array> that receives the copied items from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRowCollection"></xref>.
The first index in the specified <xref:System.Array> to receive the copied contents.
